list.notApplyingReason: This executor died (after the person who has died)

declaration.accept: I confirm that I will administer the estate of the person who died according to law, and that my application is truthful.
declaration.confirm: We confirm that we will administer the estate of Ned Stark, according to law. We will:
declaration.requests: If the probate registry (court) asks us to do so, we will:
declaration.confirmItem2: keep full details (an inventory) of the estate
declaration.confirmItem3: keep a full account of how the estate has been administered
declaration.requestsItem1: provide the full details of the estate and how it has been administered
declaration.requestsItem2: return the grant of probate to the court
declaration.submitWarning: Once everyone has agreed the legal statement and made their declaration, this information can’t be changed.
declaration.understandItem1: our application will be rejected if we do not answer any questions about the information we have given
declaration.understandItem2: criminal proceedings for fraud may be brought against us if we are found to have been deliberately untruthful or dishonest

legalStatement.intro: This statement is based on the information Rob Stark has given in their application. It will be stored as a public record.
legalStatement.deceased: Ned Stark was born on 1 January 1930 and died on 1 January 2018, domiciled in England and Wales.
legalStatement.applicant: We, Rob Stark of Pret a Manger St. Georges Hospital Blackshaw Road London SW17 0QT and Sansa Stark of Pret a Manger St. Georges Hospital Blackshaw Road London SW17 0QT, make the following statement:

executorsApplying.name: Rob Stark, an executor named in the will or codicils as Robert Stark, is applying for probate. Their name is different because Rob Stark changed their name by deed poll.
executorsApplying.sign: Rob Stark will sign and send to the probate registry what they believe to be the true and original last will and testament and any codicils of Ned Stark.

executorsApplying.name: Sansa Stark, an executor named in the will or codicils, is applying for probate.
executorsApplying.sign: Sansa Stark will sign a photocopy of what they believe to be the true and original last will and testament and any codicils of Ned Stark. Rob Stark will send the signed photocopy to the probate registry.

legalStatement.deceasedEstateLand: To the best of our knowledge, information and belief, there was no land vested in Ned Stark which was settled previously to the death (and not by the will) of Ned Stark and which remained settled land notwithstanding such death.
legalStatement.deceasedOtherNames: They were also known as King North.
legalStatement.deceasedEstateValue: The gross value for the estate amounts to £100000 and the net value for the estate amounts to £100000.
executorsNotApplying: Arya Stark, an executor named in the will or codicils, is not making this application because they died after Ned Stark died.
